y18xonM9yYQHHI6w9G5RAA.text: Amazing food best crab legs ever!!! Let's not talk about their spicy garlic sauce  the BOMB!!!   MUST TRY WHEN IN VEGAS

UKSIzLr9BgV8lwG9dphc_Q.text: My group was in town yesterday to celebrate a friend's birthday. We initially went to Hot n' Juicy, but their wait was an hour long. Across the street we saw "Urban Crawfish" and called to see what their wait was.  Luckily there was no wait and we went across to eat there. The waiter was so nice and helpful. The food was cooked fresh and quick. Everything hot and tasted good, with the exception of the blue crab we ordered. We told the waiter it seemed over cooked and he offered to switch it out for something else. My friend got another pound of shrimp and I just had mine removed from the bill.  I'd definitely be back to eat here again!

PF4mPUD0bw_z-4o28rFynQ.text: We were recommended this place and we wanted to try something new than the other common restaurants similar to this, for example Hot n Juicy. We were there on a saturday noon, and when we walked inside it was pretty slow. At first we were the only customers first. I didnt mind though, I figured its still a bit early for dinner. We were greeted with the most friendly waiter, and the music playing throughout the restaurant was like jazzy classic vibes which I enjoyed. We came at a time where it was happy hour so free domestic beer, whoo!   We started off with fried frog legs with cajun fries for an appetizer. When it came out, everything was super hot and fresh! I had to let the frog legs cool down before the oil burned me. After taking the first bite of the frog legs, you can feel the juices and the oils drip along your mouth, and it was bursting with flavor. It was SO good. The cajun fries to tag along with it, SO GOOD as well. Then we ordered the 3 combo which we chose the shrimp, clams, and crayfish and we got the sauce that had all the sauces combined.  The flavors were amazing, and the spice level was absolutely perfect. I think this place is underrated and definitely should be known more.

ES4SHORTbV_cDDirV5SFFA.text: This place was ok.   We got the Cajun fries, half a dozen Kumamoto oysters and the "Street" platter which had snow crab, shrimp, clams, corn and potatoes.   The Cajun fries were not that flavorful at all. Super bland. Had to ask for more Cajun seasoning. The oysters were good. The Street platter was good as well but it was such a small amount for the price compared to other places.   What really turned me off about this place was the amount of plastic waste there was. Every little thing was packaged in little plastic cups ( ketchup, ranch, Cajun spice, cocktail sauce, horseradish,...). I don't understand the need for all these little cups that will end up in landfills and eventually into our oceans where it ends up back on our plate inside the seafood we eat! Water and lemon wedges were also given to us in styrofoam cups.   I was not able to enjoy my meal because of all this waste. Hopefully the owner or management will implement reusable cups and dishes. Not only is this more cost effective for your business but it's will cause less damage to our already deteriorating planet.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much plastic waste.

PdonPg8NBb_gsIiomBTLfA.text: This place is definitely better than boiling crab. This place was recommended to me by my Lyft driver. He raved about this place and I knew I had to try it. When I arrived it was empty so I was kind of skeptical. I ordered the king crab legs, pound of shrimp, and the battered elote bites as an appetizer. The elotes were super delicious! They are moist and have a little spice to it. The king crab legs were juicy and well seasoned as well as the shrimp. I definitely will be back when I come back to Vegas! The portions are more than reasonable and I was pleased overall!

They also have some really awesome combination mixes. I believe I got the road and shared with my bf. We got the crawfish, shrimp, and muscles. We got their urban mix I believe it was called in spicy.   BOMB!!! I have been to the other places but the wait sometimes sucks and I don't leave the restaurant smelling like what I ate haha.   We also got Kumamoto oysters. They were yummy! I just had to squeeze a little lemon juice and just eat them. Good stuff!  I also love the concept of it being in tray. A lot of sauce evenly distributed. The only bad thing is it gets cold fast if you eat slow. But otherwise awesome! It also comes out with two potatoes, corn, and 6 sausage.

lnDznlVUA2grfbO5RZLiRg.text: This place is great!!! Food was amazing and service was fantastic!!! I completely recommend this place to anybody who loves seafood

-EvWsynI0j5xK1f4o3lonw.text: Best crawfish outside of the bayou!!!  Good and fair prices, great prices on import beers as well. Our server was Nicole and she was so sweet, knowledgable and funny. We will be back here again.  Also would love to come back for the happy hour oysters!!

DeIVSi2V4qmm1O_Cy84rlQ.text: Not sure why this place is rated 4.5 stars because our first time here was not up to par. They have an "urban mix" that includes all 4 lemon pepper, garlic butter, Cajun, and Louisiana style. However, can't just do 3 sauces. They'll only let you do one. Lame. I would think that they combine each sauce individually to make the 4 so why the big deal to just have 3? Well my party that got the urban mix said it lacked flavor. Came in on a Saturday evening with no wait, but service was very slow and unprepared. We didn't get any bibs, gloves, or had napkins on the table. We weren't offered bibs or gloves til after all the food was served, which by then some of us started eating already because we were hungry. So, there wasn't any reason for the bibs or gloves since we already got our hands dirty. Please make sure bibs and gloves are offered prior to food delivery. Also, make sure there are napkins. Disappointed that such essential items were not present. Food wasn't served together. Shrimp first then crawfish then sweet potato fries. Why are the fries last? Keep in mind the sweet potato fries were not crispy. In the end, we will not return or recommend this place.

1k8YlDmgt8FQBvoM9SvInw.text: Very good seafood.  The atmosphere was nice and the service was excellent!  The staff treats their clientele like family.  Very hospitable.  My son loved the fried frog legs and the soft shell crab was tender and delicious!  We're from LA and the next time we're in Las Vegas, we'll be coming back for some more tasty treats!!!

cjQYqTLsqjCg1gpDKSb_6w.text: We ordered the combo for two persons and it turned out so good! The restaurant was not very crowded when we got there. It was clean and nice. The service was so nice. Wonderful restaurant!! Great food and service! Worth a second time. :) Love it!

41npeaEaY4f8pBweVYc94g.text: The worst food I have had in Vegas in 15 years !!! The etouffee $6.99 + $3.00 for a few crawfish meat that was stale at best,lobster 1.55 lbs $35.63 was so tough I almost could not get it out of the shell let alone eat it tougher than the cheapest steak not able to chew it,it was way over cooked,the claws were almost empty of meat.This place is a fraud and sham,the only good thing is the root beer and the service was very good,they should train the servers to cook and dump the cooks.

hvqhgoyWkxboUjifekTofQ.text: Had their smokin sauce with crawfish and shrimp.   Fantastic flavour,  crawfish were on the small side but think it's probably the season.   Would def return.

7VSnh_g2kvh1OXA0o60Deg.text: Came here only because hot n juicy was packed.  So we thought we give it a try..  They weren't that busy,  had maybe 4 tables in total.  But our food was taking forever,  it came out one by one and they kept forgetting to bring us stuff.  Def won't be back here again.

zJwprYs-vROntnwdIdbSPA.text: Five star from start to finish!!! We started with the gator nuggets ... Best we've ever had! Didn't need sauce, but I'm a sauce person so I dipped them in the tarter sauce ... This is how tarter sauce should be! Little kick with some dill pickle, delicious! For the main I had the fried cat fish, best I've had in years! I love fried cat fish and this was top notch. Light flaky batter, big chunk of fish ... Fantastic! Even my Cajun fries were awesome. Husband had crawfish etoufee, it was awesome. We shared a pound of king crab legs in the mixture of all four sauces prepared to medium spice, I was seriously sad when we were all done, I wanted more of all of it not because I was still hungry but because it was so good! Best place we've been in Vegas! Our servers Myla and Billy were top notch, very attentive and on it 100%. We are coming back with friends tomorrow night ... Great place for family style so you can try everything.

RsEjggiww5xuI1EJHpyPEQ.text: One of the best crawfish joints in Vegas. It's actually just as good as Boiling Crab, if not better! Will definitely come back!

cgGutgUhPb-gOw7aA4pAaQ.text: I give Smokin Crawfish 5 stars because of the super good, flavorful food, the quick, excellent service, the friendly staff, and the jams that played while I ate. (And I actually didn't smell like seafood for the rest of the day like I usually do after I eat at these places, lol) The shortage of Cajun seafood restaurants in Las Vegas causes such long waits at say, Boiling Crab and Hot n Juicy. Thankfully another awesome place like this opened! You should definitely check it out :)

rx8vOQ1-_Ug58DJd6FH0BA.text: Loved it! First time here and I am definitely coming back... Bring my momma and daddy! I had medium pound of shrimp and rice. Delish!!!!

B_Rv_0S9R9wHXzHZE7baIQ.text: Came to eat lunch here with my friends no wait at all!!! If I'm comparing sauces I think this place has a thicker sauce and they're not shy with the garlic yay... Def coming back and the server was great very attentive to our needs

m4mn32cVjqLV6w_HLop5gw.text: I am from the south and know about good seafood. When I say these guys are good, I mean it!! Reminded me of being back home! If yall are looking for some good seafood definately check this place out!

oJKULLPU84wj-c_W9-uXQg.text: As a person that's been to tons of similar restaurants, this place isn't bad taste-wise. Their Smokin Style sauce is okay, but it was watery and very light. I ordered the shrimp and they were ... Shrimpy. Probably the smallest sized shrimp I've had among the other places I've tried. Also, half of our party had pretty bad stomach aches the morning after. Their Cajun fries aren't Cajun fries: they're just regular fries with some sprinkles on top. Our waitress was on the slow side but it didn't bother me. However, when it came to splitting our bill, I don't think she understood us. She just separated each guest by order on the same receipt by grouping our orders, but there were no subtotals or separate checks. She also mistakenly put an extra order of an entire bucket of beer. Luckily we were able to catch it before paying. Anyway, this caused a seriously delayed paying process for our group even though we were told our checks were going to be split. I probably wouldn't come back here.

hFPvZDxCafWpcKklqSbxJg.text: My new favorite seafood restaurant of its kind. Food is fresh, sauces are amazing, and the service is fantastic. Loan was helpful and friendly. Can't wait to go back!!

tePOVHqWm6hOdi9naWphfA.text: the very best place to go for seafood, specifically the Kumamoto oyster. love it.....

V-d8FxP1beowQLiyKKNXmQ.text: Our server Billy was great and the food was excellent. We had the group deal smoking flavor mild. The mild actually was spicy so I can't imagine how hot the other options were.

3MgkdzDZXp6hmWUffTfuRQ.text: Food was amazing!!! Fried alligator was a wonderful surprise. Crawfish were huge & fresh.  Our server Billy was super attentive & friendly.  Family had a great dinner.  We loved that we didn't leave the restaurant smelling like garlic. Will be back

eo7kFxDX0kKt-e23lUcg8g.text: Service was great! Food is just as awesome. The urban sauce which is a combination of all sauces was the best! But really, the star of the table is the Etouffe.. So yummy! I'd go back just for that!

Y8U8wMnVrgRuWAxwFYBdnA.text: Went to Smokin' Crawfish today with my mother.  Let me preface this review by saying how I have been a Hot N Juicy Crawfish girl.  I'm the kind of person who sits down and eats several pounds of this boiled goodness.....seriously!  Now, this is actually a really good location.  Plenty of parking in a shopping center that is really easy to get to right off of Spring Mountain and Decatur (ironically directly across the street from its competitor).    When you first walk in, the space seems small.  Several booths that sit two comfortably, four it you want to get snuggly with your eating companions.  Two long tables for larger parties, but the benches are permanently placed in the floor, so getting in and out can be a feat of acrobatics and flexibility if there are a lot of you sitting there.  The servers and owner are amazingly friendly and take their time to answer any questions you have.  We had Kevin, and thank you Kevin for all of your help.  Your recommendations were spot on.  And now the food!  Kevin recommended the Kumamoto Oysters, and let me tell you they are a must!  Yes, they are more pricey than the standard Blue Point Oyster, but oh so worth it.  They are perfectly sized in a nice deep shell, texture is phenomenal (no slimy feeling), and very sweet in taste.  for the appetizer, I got the half dozen at today's market price and was not disappointed.    For the main course, I chose 1lb of crawfish (fresh frozen today's market price $7.99/lb), 1lb green mussels (today's market price $9.99/lb), and 1lb of the regular shrimp (today's market price $10.99/lb).  Now, most people come in and do the meal deals, one of which is pick any three of four options a 1lb a piece of crawfish, clams, mussels or shrimp.  The deals come with 2 pieces of corn, 2 potatoes and two sausages.  Being that I am not a fan of corn, potato and sausage, I went with the non-meal deal so not to waste the food.   You get a choice of four different sauces and spice levels.  I went with the Garlic Butter flavor in mild as I am a major wussy when it comes to spiciness.  Ha...it still has a kick!!!  My mouth was on fire by the end of the meal.  I talked to the owner Loan about the flavors, and she explained that the spiciness is what sets them apart from the other crawfish locations, so be aware that it is spicier than what you may be used to.  But oh the flavor!  The Garlic Butter was so flavorful, not overpowering in garlic and not heavy or greasy.    The crawfish was fresh/frozen, but except for their not being a lot of juice to sucks out of the head, you never would have known.  The meat was very sweat and tender.  They were all medium is size, so nothing over cooked, which is a huge problem during the off season.  The green mussels were fresh and tender and very large in size.  And the shrimp were almost melt in your mouth.  So, three pounds of food (which i would like to say I shared, but nope...all me) ad garlic butter cover hands (and arms), and I have decided this is my new go to crawfish place.  It is a little spicier than I prefer, but I think I will get used to it.  The servers are phenomenal and helpful (which really makes a huge difference).  Crafish season will kicking off end of December or early January, and I am waiting to see what happens pricewise.  This place has been open for a little over five weeks, so I will have to wait and see how it fairs in the long haul.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mom got the Oyster Poboy...bread was so fresh and Oysters melted in your mouth!
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1lb of crawfish, 1lb of shrimp &amp; 1lb of green mussels mild garlic butter spice and still a little spicy for me.
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kumamoto Oysters......so sweet and good!  Totally worth the price!

Pwt-6HoOQzH25THa5ANU8g.text: My favorite place! It's never too packed & we always get helped right away. We never have to wait too long for our food & it's always so damn good!

BaVv3j4Dxu2g1-cLJqoYmw.text: I frequent this place often, like at least once a month. In my opinion it's better than hot and juicy and boiling crab. It's never to busy, the sauces are better and richer than its competitors. Although in the last few months the amount of sauce in the bags of seafood has become less and less. At one point and time I was denied extra sauce on a to go order because they got word of someone trying to duplicate their recipe... Otherwise I like the establishment, I just wish they would be more consistent.

Nd7v1tpdYgEhzDu4iQUN9A.text: I'm so glad we wondered away from the strip. This place is phenomenal! A real hearty meal served by the friendliest people I have dined with in Las Vegas.   We sat at a paper covered bench while Billy educated us on our options. He was spot on with his recommendations, the medium chilli sauce was golden, the fried catfish crispy and the alligator soft.   Get away from the strip...

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy campers!!!! Thanks Billy!

7QiEb72zOOQ8khR8fJOdXw.text: So I just tried the Urban Crawfish Station with my mom on Valentine's day. This probably ranks as my lowest experience with type of place (boiling crab, hot & juicy ect) I asked for a garlic butter and not only did it take forever to come but it came out looking like brown taffy. The shrimp and crawfish were over cooked. I shouldn't have to ask for a bib. Our waitress seemed overworked. Sauce was good. Won't be returning.

YO0TFkmx3jqbIF5XydnjGg.text: Let's start with the positives: great service like great service. The sauce is really good get the combo sauce it's like smokin sauce or something like that. The more expensive seafood is fairly fresh.   Now the negatives: the food was overcooked; the lobster was chewy, the shrimp was chewy. Clams were really not fresh some of them didn't even open up which means they were dead.   We did come on a Thursday at 4:30 so maybe that's why it wasn't the 4.5 star experience that everyone else gave it. But it was good some redeeming qualities but the seafood itself wasn't great it was ok.

qlZ4nDrfLpGIby7o7zkS7g.text: Great food in a really chill and casual atmosphere. Similar to Boiling Crab but a little more of a dive.

GSDg8SDFWuKKZrW-AQUH7g.text: My husband and I came here on a Thursday night and the place was empty. I'm so glad we decided to give this place a try cause the food was BOMB and the service was even better!! We got the combo of lobster, shrimp and crab smothered in their spicy garlic butter sauce that is to die for. The crawfish po boy was absolutely delicious too. Everything tasted on point and so fresh & we left completely satisfied. I would definitely stop by again the next time I'm in town. The staff were so nice and friendly, thank you guys for a great experience!

UlXLcNhyT5j7dnogPbRZ8A.text: I'm not into crawfish but my wife and I love seafood, and we got a recommendation to this place over Hot & Juice. On Valentine's day, and my wife's B-day we decided to give it a try. Were we glad we did! We got there right before dinner rush, and got seated right the way. The place was clean, server was awesome, and the food was great! We tried the alligator appetizer, and loved it! From service to food everything was wonderful, we highly recommend it!!!

_CGt2Ufj1RZP9LykHjNHxA.text: Can't beat it when you stumble on a great meal. A bit apprehensive when we entered... full and happy when we left. Seafood was fresh and delicious and the staff was very pleasant. Highly recommend if looking for a great seafood meal in Vegas.

cTpZNvE8xvbB3noe8cTYEQ.text: Found this place on yelp With good reviews.  I ordered lobster and blue crab with the urban mix seasoning. Great!! The staff came by and checked with me regularly and VERY nice!  I will certainly come back when I'm back in Vegas!

z42q3l8wA_P-BUkZGru5Rg.text: We love this place ! We've been regulars here for about the last year . The owner is amazing , her little daughter is a cutie and the staff is awesome . The prices and quality are spot on , you always get more than you pay for . No matter what you do , ALWAYS get the urban mix ! The sauce is second to none . Wonderful service . We will always come back !

DUZavDzvylg_0tywU98sxA.text: I'm a HUGE fan of southern cuisine and this place really has given me a pleasant surprise. This by far has been the first place that has it right and everything was hot and fresh. I ordered the catfish basket with Cajun fries, crawfish Po Boy, corn on the cob and a side of that remix sauce. I had to try a little of it all as you can see and everything was GREAT! The only thing missing was a couple smiles and good greetings from the staff, I walked in and a waitress was sitting at a dining table in her phone...besides the customer service issue I'll definitely be back.

9midsFBGgCzzPtYHVkwe1A.text: Wow it's really good. The sauce flavor is amazing and shrimp very fresh. Definitely one of the best cajun seafood place Ive ever ate at. The 1 lb of shrimp I ordered is defintely at least 1 pound. Very generous. The cajun fries were good but Ive tried better at other cajun places. Overall I highly recommend this restaurant.

y204aVNAHet0iDeUoN3Isg.text: Went here a few times. Love love love my oysters. Kevin is an awesome server. Kept my cousins and I laughing. We got lucky and went there when it wasn't so packed. The rice is a big serving size. Might want to share if you don't eat a lot of rice. Oysters are always great and we love the shrimp! :)

G4M8TJST_9sLntmSh-vgBg.text: Casual and unpretentious, but delivered on the promise of seasoned crab, shrimp and crawfish boil, that took me back to childhood meals of steamed crab or lobster boils served on newspaper with bibs.  They use butcher paper here, but the feel is relaxed and festive at the same time.  We made a reservation for 5:30 since we had a group of 5 or more, but did not need it at 5:30 on Friday. My ten-year-old son was excited to try frog legs and alligator for the first time. Decor is a bit kitschy, but cute, with wooden crawfish or crab traps, restaurant clean and well maintained. Mika greeted us warmly and seated us at a long picnic-style table in her section.  Her service was genuinely warm and friendly with helpful information and suggestions. We had: Corn bites- 5 stars Onion Rings- 5 stars Fried Shrimp -4 stars Etouffe-4 stars Frog legs- I was not a big fan, tho I had liked them at another place years ago-- these were a bit like slimy chicken Alligator- 4 stars tasted like good chicken nuggets with a good spicy sauce Crawfish Po Boy-- I never got a bite but the guys seemed to enjoy King Crab with Urban Mix - 5 stars.  $32 /lb- 2 large legs in spicy sauce. Very good, but in future I will choose a more subtle sauce to go with the delicate king crab, and save the more intense sauce for crawfish or shrimp. Beer and sake selection ok, wine limited to Mondavi Woodbridge Chardonnay and cabernet for $5 glass. attempted the live lobster claw machine in back for $2 a try to get a lobster, which they will cook for you-- which is a fun thing to try. Unless you can get the claw tangled between the legs, the lobsters just slip out.

slyLO9LJfWi3uCkY1juKqg.text: I love spicy and I loveeeee seafood. My coworker and I enjoyed going to Hot n Juicy but she told me that this place was the new contender so I had to see for myself.   I'd have to disagree.... but it's not bad like some of the other places in Vegas.  Pros:  -Menu options are great, especially on the back where you can get large combo platters if you and a friend want to share a variety.  -Menu is pretty clear and easy to understand.  -Lobster claw game at $2 a play is entertaining at best but difficult to grab, lobsters are usually clumped together in the corner -Sauce is not oily like the competition which kept my stomach ache free  Cons: -There was a manager lady who wasn't friendly at all. I was seated by a gentlemen but the lady came by to drop off the menus without a single kind gesture, and didn't even ask if I wanted anything to drink while I wait for my friends. -The sauce is less oil but lacks heavily in flavor. The hot n juicy special is loaded with spices and garlic to give you a delicious kick. The sauce here was spicy but bland -All the seafood is market price and listed on a tiny neon menu in the center of the restaurant. Maybe putting more around the restaurant so people don't have to get up to see it -Shrimp is puny.....  (no pun intended)  Overall: I'd come back with friends but this wouldn't be my go to. I think i'll just stick with my pepto and hot n juicy

eQhU3uQnmF2lmfgIQw06vg.text: Wow, I can't believe I was considering waiting an hour for A crawfish place across the street. Urban Crawfish Station was fantastic! No wait time, plenty of people eating happily, food was off the hook! You have to try their Urban Mix sauce!! The servers were so nice and the atmosphere was pretty cool. I love the decoration, it's very urban and not obnoxious.  Thank you so much Urban Crawfish Station for giving us a really good experience  Definitely coming back!

LKsGfdCewc4_91wuQdWk6w.text: This place is great great service and great food! My favorites are the crab legs and of course the crawfish!

fvJcD_BRTTL_WeUEG5iHnQ.text: I'm a big crawfish fan and my husband took me this place for my birthday. We ordered 1 lb of crawfish and 1 lb of shrimp. They were both delicious, especially the shrimp. We even thought about going back there the next day for their shrimp. I will definitely go back next time we are in Vegas!

EL9YmBVSdas5_na6IhC1Pg.text: Just meh? I never thought I'd say that creole cajun food was just meh!   In California, whenever anyone hears the words "boiling crab" they go nuts from excitement and dying addiction. Everyone's pupils dilate with hunger as saliva produces and drips from the mouth. Oh it's an entire EVENT when Cajun food is a part of the daily plan.   Here in Vegas, there aren't many options or locations. I figured I'd try this joint since they had an enticing happy hour oyster deal.   Mm...overall, service from Kevin was GREAT. Food wise, the shrimps were overcooked and small. And the cocktail sauce for the oysters was wayyy tooo thick of a consistency. Almost like a gelatinous and mucous consistency. Not a fan!! Somehow, somewhere we also decided to get the shrimp po boy. As plain as that sandwhich looked, it was probably the best thing on the table. Yum! Cajun fries, always my favorite part, didn't blow me away. I didn't like the Burger King thickness of the fries, and their Cajun seasoning wasnt very Cajun. We asked for more. Sad panda!  Wish I loved this place, but maybe I'll give it another try in the future and have a change of heart.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun fries, not too Cajun at all.
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters.

4mfAgtBmVouoJdb3bHd8Zg.text: The. Best. Their Urban Mix is to die for and the alligator sauce is amazing! Service is great, super clean inside. Puts Hot n' Juicy to shame!!

QgyBeGkslUDZ_FU083Ma4w.text: My boyfriend and I wanted to find a place for date night and my cousin recommended urban crawfish instead of boiling crab so we decided to give it a shot. Got one of their set menus and ordered king crab, shrimp and crawfish. They also have a lobster claw game and we ended up winning two dollar lobster! All in all will DEFINITELY be coming back, the server was amazing, the food was flavored perfectly, cooked amazing, all in all definitely worth it. There's also boba places nearby as well as in the restaurant if you're craving a sweet treat afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BsjEJcDfrelRlvdHUuY9kA.text: Best crawfish ever! We come here every time we visit.  I get all the seasoning in one. It was so juicy and order extra garlic. Servers are nice and down to earth. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eUIOYtPmjVr-3132NDE9iw.text: You got me at $1 dollar oysters then got me even better with $2 beer!!!   Happy hour is from 12-5 pm MON- FRI. They also have daily specials like FRI-SUN FREEEE domestic beer with a purchase of $7. Something like that. That's already so much to offer!   My friend suggested going here because of their dollar oysters, you do have to check in though to be eligible for that deal. Anyway, so my friend and I started with a half dozen each, got our own beers, then ended up getting a pound of shrimp to share.  But anyways we got here around 4 pm today and it was quite empty. There was only about 3 tables so the service was fast. Our server was quirky and funny. Lol.   Our food came quite fast about 15 mins for the oyster and shrimp to come. The oysters were blue point I believe, and they were SUPERBBB!! They were so fresh and just so so yummy (I ended up totaling to a dozen all on my own; my friend ended up with a dozen too). As for the shrimp, we got the urban mix seasoning which is their mixture of all sauces. I noticed that in comparison to Hot n juicy and boiling crab... their sauce was on the sweeter side. They did have a good Cajun seasoning to butter ratio though. I liked it!   That's all we ordered, but some things that stuck out to me when reading the menu was they had fried frog legs, fried alligator, fried rice and seafood spaghetti. I mean, that's a big selection!  I'd have to try that next time when I can bring an extra stomach.   This is a place I can definitely see myself coming to often for the great deals and food!   Oh they also have this claw machine that has lobster in it. If you can it, they cook it! Haha. Didn't get a picture of that though. Next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JAd0xr9TsVVmZxwZiLoAzA.text: Great vibe & food. If you  want a welcoming & friendly ambiance you should check them out. You will not feel overcrowded or rushed. More of a family dining experience instead of an overrated, stuffy chain restaurant.

3ZvgJRmHbBZYCEp0t2krOg.text: When in Vegas and craving crawfish, you must come here. Freshest oysters ever, best seasoning for crawfish, so good that I crave it when I'm back home in Toronto. I always order fresh oysters, fried oysters, Dungeness crab, crawfish, clams (I think it's the avenue combo). It's tooo good!! Customer service is fast and friendly. I always recommend Urban Crawfish Station to all my friends who visit Vegas. 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NUa-_cuMYLnNCOfbPL2XzA.text: This place was amazing! I threw a surprise birthday dinner for my boyfriend and this was the only seafood place that took reservations. I attempted to go to Boiling Crab but they weren't even trying to give me access to a table until 75% of my party arrived and they were rude! So at the last minute I stumbled across this place and they took my reservation, allowed me to decorate and refrigerated our cake for us! The whole staff was extremely nice. We will definitely be back!

AJdXEAAM5GGIQGYSmI7aSA.text: The food here is amazing. I have eaten at Cajun crawfish places elsewhere but this place easily holds top spot. The sauce is incredible! We got the street combo with crab legs, shrimp, and clams. It was super tasty. The spice level is higher than you think so if you can't handle heat, don't go above a 1.   The menu has options for kids too which is nice. Service was friendly and prompt. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kirf0Lukv5wZoj8jTaTn3g.text: Such a long overdue review for this restaurant. We came on a Wednesday afternoon, it was really slow. The lady was really nice and very entertaining to us. So the service was real good.  We came here Becuase of their $1 oysters. Which isn't a bad deal at all. So me and girlfriend purchased 24 pieces (2 Dozen). We were craving oysters that's why.   We also ordered the Road combo which is about $40.95 which included: 1Lb-Shrimp, 1Lb-Crawfish, and 1Lb Clams. Also corn, potato, and Suasages. Our flavor was the Urban Mix which is super good ! Everything tasted fresh.  Overall our experience was outstanding and this place beats other seafood stations in my opinion. We'll be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Road combo ! 3Lbs.
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $1 Oysters M-F before 5pm plus $2 Domestic beer !

ooAk75zWYhOxIP3vz3fdOA.text: This place kicks ass! I'm from Georgia visiting and decided w a friend to just take a chance. Very clean place (including the bathrooms!) and the mud bugs were the best I've ever had, no kidding. Leaves Louisiana in the dust. Highly recommend

dEVgyaZ3eDqqK2Ga4sBJKQ.text: We were in Vegas this past weekend and we were looking for a good spot to eat. It was pretty late, Everyone in our group was craving seafood but we couldn't find any places that would be open by the time we made the drive out to the locations. I came across urban crawfish and decided to give it a go! Right when you walk in you immediately smell all the goodness that's cooking in the kitchen. We were greeted by one of their friendly staff, they told us it would be a short wait and offered us seats at the bar while we waited for a table to open. Our waiter made it easy to order by giving us pointers on their menu. I got their "Road combo" which gave you a choice of 3 types of seafood on their menu, plus sausages, potatoes and corn. It was a bit over $40 bucks, which I thought was a deal!! The amount of food could easily feed 2 people. Overall my family was extremely pleased with the quality and quantity of food, the flavor, atmosphere and staff. Can't wait to be back in Vegas. This will definitely be a spot to comeback to!

GbMP5g08Kg9bYViNI5B39g.text: This place is a must try. The Hibachi Shrimp Fried Rice is to die for. I have never had fried rice this good. The service for great. I am the type of person who is nervous to try new foods.  I had the fried alligator and it was good.  There was not one thing that was ordered that was not delicious. We even ordered food to go home with, even though we didn't finish our food. The potions were great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters, fried soft shell crab, hibachi shrimp fried rice, fried alligator basket, urban mix wings and fried jumbo shrimp basket

UAwuDhRSkd0eMvnO514w5g.text: Food is amazing with reasonable price. The coffee is so good and underrated. You gotta try the coffee if you come here

J3PUg9oqW5SFqr62FO0d9g.text: Excellent Crawfish etoufee!!! Fried Rice was yummy. The Fried shrimp was breaded perfectly. Happy Hour was great they have Bud light Lime Kim our server Rocks!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy  Yummy to my Tummy!!!
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Crawfish Etoufee in Vegas!!!
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let the good times roll

aJvzSH2cjD2gjoHrUnRjDg.text: Great place to hangout good music good scenario good service and the food was delicious. They serve you the seafood in a large platter instead of bags like other places

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Urban mix Dungeouness crab

cESqTL_AWRGgUpcsYquOBg.text: Holly Molly this place is so good it's worth every penny. We found this place by accident on a trip to Vegas and not wanting another buffet.  We ordered the Special that comes with King crab,  Snow crab ( we added this to the special) , shrimp, muscles, and clams.  It's a bit pricey but the flavor and the amount of food you get is a good deal and enough for two hungry adults.  Everything from the potatoes, to the corn, and the crabs it's all full of flavor.  The restaurant is very clean and the bathrooms not bad at all.  Customer service always goes a long way with me and the staff here has always been really friendly (all three times i have been to this place).   We will definitely be back every time we come to Vegas.

R3CW6wxa5pvn1K_G-_rClA.text: The combo was A-MAZING! Got the street with lobster. The mix sauce was so good I wanted a spoon to slurp it up. Fried oysters were delish!

prnhrSi4-a8cDckf3xsB6w.text: I give it 3 Stars simply because the Shrimp poboy only comes with 3 shrimp and you have to pay $1.75 for extra which is only 1 shrimp! Then on top of that poboys don't come with fries, the catfish basket only comes with 3 small pieces of catfish .. I'm from out of town and I'm sorry to tell you all but they're really jipping you guys. And I'm from where they actually catch the seafood in town..the calamari was great though.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Al9vWucU5fRmB0g25wj41w.text: The smokin flavor and garlic flavor are amazingly good. The sauce is not too salty and not too thick. Service was outstanding. I will come back!!!

zIotXOqI5j4MhaHQ0sjb9w.text: Delicious, messy and fun! Great fun making a mess with my parents and not getting in trouble  Ordered the combo for two - was enough for the three of us. Excellent - I plan on returning for the po boy!

BXNiK4PwbR6u_7P6OExYtg.text: Food was delicious. Service was excellent. You don't smell like their sauce when you leave the restaurant. A lot better than the other crawfish restaurant. Highly recommended.

03ZZrHgE-3NyDuycaEUo_w.text: Just tried for the first time.  Flavor of the sauce  was excellent and the portions were BIG.  I recommend  to anyone that likes seafood to come here.

7e9D0gMETyYvniqD2GIZNg.text: Loved this place! Food is better than the other more popular option. Excellent food and service. We had the freshest shrimp, crawfish and clams in urban mix sauce.

3lKmF2ea-qd480YXATEb1A.text: New crawfish joint. Locally owned, and the crawfish tastes alot fresher than the other crawfish places in Vegas

umeAyR9MtokLUUZUrCtXfg.text: I come here with my boyfriend, we eat crab legs  and somkin crab ! It is very delicious, and it is not expensive, although I am a Chinese! Try it!

hlMg2lCjcCtpIoNCLxhORA.text: This place had nothing that was great. The coconut shrimp appetizer was not good and the dipping sauce didn't go with it. We had the Cajun fries which were just OK and 1lb shrimp with the everything sauce not very flavorful. To top it off the service was horrible

tK7IqaCCojJMoxSbcRxdMg.text: It was a Saturday night around 10:50, we were heading to boiling crab, but it was closed. Then we tried to go hot and juicy crawl fish, but it was closing at 11. Then we found this spot on Yelp.  It's surprisingly good. The sauce is a tiny bit sweeter than Boiling Crabs. If you come here get the garlic butter sauce. It's the best IMO.

NaI7LxXSCa2PeZmSwx8u8Q.text: Awesome food! The seafood is really tasty with the home-make seasoning. The stuff is very friendly and she gave us tips on where to go in Vegas.

cBBGXp4NjypzZR4r2PJZnQ.text: Flavorful rice, excellent service. Not too keen on paper plates and plastic forks. To be fair we only tried the rice but it was good. I would recommend cooking shrimp separately then tossing it with the rice to avoid over cooking shrimp.

V4xV7wcGq8Y5ZVJsXpg47Q.text: Great flavor! Spicy means spicy. The service is awesome the staff is really friendly and very attentive.

7pjh2jJGtW4gazTF0mTZTw.text: Found this new crawfish joint while passing by. Being a seafood person I definitely wanted to try it out. I ended up ordering two pounds of crawfish and one pound of shrimp. The flavor I got was the popular garlic butter/ medium. Both the crawfish and shrimp was really good. The sauce had a good flavor and seemed light and not too heavy. The sausages  I ordered in the bag of crawfish was really good and filling as well. Shiley our waitress provided great customer service! Really friendly and making sure she was there for refills on water or anything else. Overall I had a great experience at this new joint! Everyone should give this place a try!

FfqVr0yrgYwOZUTRcuYOUA.text: This place is absolutely AMAZING!! The food was awesome and the customer service is just as awesome ! My wonderful server Mika was very polite and knowledgeable!!! I will be recommending this place to any and everyone I know !

kxRhoL6pkbflZq9Jmgys_A.text: Ate here for the first time and wIll definitely be coming back. Food as great and our server, Ramika was very attentive and friendly! She made the dining experience an even more pleasant one.

-eIaeHJAT4Sc1xgIfKrqXQ.text: Went here last week on a Wednesday around 2:00. We were the only ones in the place.  we ordered a couple of the combos on the menu so we could try a bit of everything. Everything came out promptly and tasted good. The sauce was not as spicy as we would of liked but they were quick to resolve it. The lobster was a bit over cooked but good and the service was excellent except for trying to up sell us on everything. Sorry, I don't want to pay 30 bucks for a dozen oysters. The Blue points that we had were delicious.  I would have also like to have won a lobster in the claw game but I didn't. They asked us to do a yelp review and gave us 10% off our bill. It was still 150.00 for three people after the discount. We did order a lot of food though even though we're not fat. I would eat here again, if they make the lobster game easier to win and have a full bar.  Really though- i would eat here again. please have crackers for the oysters next time. thanks! Not the same as HnJ or BC but just as good.

H8d7pJCzQcovNdVYHxBV_w.text: My boyfriend and I were in town visiting from Louisiana and decided to give this place a try. We were very hesitant at first because I'm picky with my seafood, but this place was amazing! Service was great & owner even came to our table. We got the smoking garlic butter combo #2 that came with snow crabs, crawfish, shrimp, corn, potatoes, and sausage. Everything was delicious. They also have $2 domestic beers and 10% off your bill during happy hour!

RY1lhqB3fw0ze10ndCQYVw.text: Went in for Mother's Day dinner and were treated amazingly by Billy. Food was perfectly seasoned and delicious. We will go back!

lws-PLPixW39uat4gRx4cg.text: Great place! Nice people awesome food. It's just a tad hotter just like HnJ but the fish tasted fresher. The lobster claw machine is a great idea. See you all again real soon.

MqnKrSh9tVspjGOYt0NdoA.text: This place is a hidden gem...me and the hubby go to our usual boiling crab or hot n juicy and we decided to give this place a try...and so glad we did because it surpassed our expectations and is now at the top of our list! Love the sauce because it's not so thick but more butter based. Customer service was on point! Definitely coming back.

Q4GXcQWfc5HBOGt0edWyjg.text: I was in Vegas for a quick getaway trip and since I'm a huge crawfish fanatic, I had to try a couple places here in Vegas. My first spot was Hot and Juicy crawfish on the strip. Overall it was great but after I had a taste of Urban Crawfish Starion, it was amazing. H&L flavor was good but the garlic was  too overwhelming for me. Urban Crawfish is probably the best crawfish place in Vegas! And not to mention the great customer service!

bvLyJbYIh0DYBEcr3x1BwQ.text: Came here after looking for a good seafood place near us and the place did not dissapoint. Lots of good food. We'll definitely come back.  There's an arcade type machine where you can catch your own lobster with a mechanical claw. We didn't try it but it looks fun.

_D9XvCLqGslH4GFkyMpbIg.text: Do you like to eat like a king and witness exquisite dance routines via your gracious server? Well this is the place for you! Seriously though, my taste buds are singing. I can die now. Also, the staff is entertaining as hell!

C7VB14zcb3RlTafaiIf6mQ.text: We ordered the crawfish, shrimp and mussel boil and it was absolutely delicious!!! Food came out really fast too!!! Will definitely come back

oxfChOdnvUp7qoV8oc5yiw.text: Sooooooo good. This is the second time coming here, and they did not disappoint! Everything I've had here has been delicious. Coming from Seattle, I never have high expectations for seafood in the desert, but this place is awesome!

WG7IOA7s3BEUoKyzCeP41g.text: Our plans changed on valentine's day so we drove around. Wanted boiling crap but it was too busy. We ended up here. Wasn't busy at all. Got sat down. Ordered food. Our waiter took couple tries to get our order correct.  Should write it down if you're having a hard time remembering.  Got our order. There were couple shrimps in the batch that seemed really old and nasty. Still I wasn't dissapointed. It can happen right? Finally in the middle of our dinner I found a cockroach next to me on the bench seat. Didn't wanna cause a scene, quietly got an employees attention to get it away. Towards the end I think the  owner came up to me and told me sorry and that it's hard to totally eliminate the bug problem. Told them it was ok. When we finally got the bill they still charged us full price. I should've been comped ice tea, steam rice and maybe corn. Those items are really nothing for them. Just saying.

dwle01E2MemB8IlTW5RYnQ.text: Another visit and I am STILL IN LOVE!  Had lunch with my husband and my son, Mika took care of us, and not only did she take care of us, but she was the only one on the floor and she took care of EVERYONE!  Again the food was PERFECT! I had my shrimp "as usual", along with extra sauce, I dip my fries in it and my husband and son dip their sandwiches in it!  Smokin' Crawfish has never let me down!

7tqSP_rp-F6E90RHGzW87g.text: Okay. Barely okay.  Frozen crawfish....not exactly smokin'. Shrimp was okay. Mussels okay.  The wait-staff were terrific: attentive and engaging, but the food is no better or worse than all the other Crustacea Commercial Endeavors in town.   Smokin' Crawfish should be SmOKin' Crawfish.  Okay?

NHBGGmpsREfQEwwiI4kV7Q.text: Wow!  Loved eating here. Food is amazing. Had a lot of everything. Crawfish,hot!  Coconut shrimp, tasty. Wings, classic good. Alligator, unique, excellent. Amazing fries. Catch your lobster for $2, and they'll prepare it. Kick butt service. Our waitress was amazing: Lo An.  Even trained us on how to peel and eat crawfish. Gave everyone at our table there first tails and brain!  Amazing. Thank you Lo An.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TSIfozGbMwxqVt0zhMk3ew.text: Great food and great people. A must come place in your Vegas trip!!!!!!!!! I have two combo in a roll!! I will definitely come here next time!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AJ-Z8kN84SjDa3PWfns8_w.text: Good food. Taste so good. The portion is decent. Plus, the lobster picking game is fun to play but hard to pick one. Over all I will rate this restaurant a 5 star. Will be back next time to visit Vegas.

QM7GJoEaa3tBQGy90cNmyQ.text: This place comes in 2nd to Hot N Juicy. I ordered the fried calamari and when it came out it was like 10 small pieces of calamari, which I was kind of disappointed. For my meal, I ordered the combo they had for $59.95 for 3lbs of succulent seafood. I chose the lobster, shrimp, and mussels. I would say that the flavor is there and is very good, but not better than Hot N Juicy. The value you get for the price though, is better than HNJ. Also, the service here is excellent. The staff is super friendly and helpful and I was very impressed.

mIUHqX3ClqIwQaeTEwDLww.text: You must go here!! Nicole is the best server!! Food that she recommend is the best!! Get the Smokin Flavors!!   Oh man, this is better than Hot n Juicy and Boiling Crabs!!  New Spot!!! Check it!!

Bp3VEupodpYHyg6eFMl63Q.text: We got seated right away and it was pretty busy so that was good. The waitress is nice and she was able to take our picture. She went out of her way to get what we asked for. I got the 1lb shrimp with smokin style which was good. It was the right amount of flavor for me. They did forget my corn on the cob with my shrimp but they got it. Overall, the atmosphere is great for family. The food is great too.

qGKReoxF783DXbhCTqij9w.text: Experience: My friend had a get-together here on a Saturday at 6pm. There were 14 of us. I have been wanting to try this place as I am a Louisiana gal still trying to find some decent southern or Cajun/Creole cuisine to bring me back home.   Facility:  The restaurant is located in a strip mall. This is a cute, casual place that is fairly small. Our big party sat in the middle on picnic bench style tables. They also had several booths along the walls. The decor is cute with seafood traps scattered around.   Service:  Our waiter was Phil. He was pretty attentive and patient with our big group. They did make a few mistakes on our food, and apologized, but it did make for some people getting their food as others finished. However, I was impressed that all the food came out hot and fresh...I'd rather eat at different times, then bringing it all at once and some food is cold.   Food:  I liked the food. We ordered a ton and there wasn't anything I didn't like.  CRAWFISH - 3.5/5 - I ordered Louisiana Style, the hottest they could make it, with sausage, potato and corn. Ok, for "frozen" crawfish in Las Vegas, this was pretty decent. The shells were hard to peel sometimes and the some of the crawfish was a little tough, but it was frozen, and maybe a tad overcooked. But the flavor was good. I even liked the andouille, and that's rare in this town.  CATFISH - 4/5 - I liked the catfish. It was steaming hot, and battered well with cornmeal. The tarter was good, so I enjoyed this dish.  FROG LEGS - 4/5- Surprisingly, these were pretty good. They were battered well, and came out hot!  They were a little bland, but I like the tarter sauce on them anyway.  ALLIGATOR - 4/5 - These were good...small bites that were battered perfectly and came out pipping hot. We ordered this Cajun spiced, but I didn't really taste much spice. Again, I love this in tarter sauce.  COCONUT SHRIMP - 4/5 - I really liked the flavor on the batter of these. Perfect balance of coconut.  SHRIMP - 3/5 - I tasted my friend, and she ordered it Smokin style at the spiciest. It was good, but just too much garlic for me.  CAJUN FRIES - 5/5 - The fries came out hot and fresh every time. The portions were big and everyone devoured these.   Overall:  Much better than the other Crawfish place.  I'm not expecting crawfish like home, because this is not Louisiana, but I would come back here again. Plus all the fried foods were very good and all came out pipping hot! Plus they have beer! :D

0F340i_7MetUMnxcWBocGg.text: Really good! Better than Boiling Crab and Hot n Juicy Crawfish! Our server Nicole was really friendly and on point with our refills! NQ_uRGnla7dk7oUdU9sVAw.text: Came here for a bachelor party in the afternoon and we had the whole restaurant to ourselves, beats waiting in line at the others.  Ordered medium Urban and it didn't have much taste,  but the spicy Urban I got on the side def made up for it.  Mika was a sweet waitress. Mos def worth another visit when I'm in town...

L0bnQeaPKm9EJv39he95Gg.text: I went here for the first time yesterday for lunch and I was pretty excited to get the deal for $1 oysters. You can buy 6 or 12 at a time.   I'm usually skeptical about trying other crawfish places that aren't hot n juicy or boiling crab because they're never as satisfying. I got a lb of live crawfish for $11.99. I chose mild "smokin' style" which is a mixture of all the sauces.  I like my food spicy but I thought the mild was a lil spicier than I usually prefer. The sauce had great flavor. I wouldn't say it's better than HNJ only because I love the garlicy flavor there. I do love the chunks of garlic in the sauce here though and I love that they give u a wide tin pan to dump the crawfish in so the sauce is easier to scoop up.   We were the only customers during lunch. I couldn't stop thinking about how good the crawfish was, mainly because how big they were! I had to go out and get more crawfish for dinner the next day. I decided to go to Boiling Crab only because it was a little closer. I drove by and saw all of the people waiting so I decided to check out Smokin' Crawfish for dinner. I was in luck! There were only 2 other tables in there (big groups). No wait!   I chose extra mild this time and the spice level was good. I also got to taste the corn. This is the first time I had a sweet corn in my crawfish boil. And yet again, the crawfish were huge! Loved that!  I've had awesome service each time I came. This place is great!

5-LU2RRv3i-o6TSR6Mm-Ow.text: Great spot!  I had the crawfish  smoking style extra spicy.  Crawfish were fresh and perfectly cooked.  They have a bar big  enough to crack crabs and not be cramped.  I'm coming back!!

YEJtg7AlIjf5px1vP5F4FQ.text: Loved the environment, the music and the food. If you love garlic this place is it ! The garlic and seafood paired really well with one another. We came here instead of waiting an hour at boiling crab and lemme say it was not a disappointment. We were seated quick (party of 5) we ordered right away and the prices were great for everything we gotten. I will say as it got busier we waited longer to get refills, or even extra condiments. But overall it was a pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Urban Crawfish Station - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g7u1x_8NORhD1c5lzlLVIQ.text: We ordered the roadhouse, which came with 3lbs of seafood, 2 corns, 2 potatoes, and 6 sausages, and it was delicious! Definitely recommend the urban mix in spicy if you like a good kick and garlicky goodness.

htk_9uEpZ5zrkGAPmUFJmA.text: Came here on Monday at lunch to take advantage of the happy hour $1.00 oyster.   We ordered a dozen.  They were very fresh!  Would have loved to get more horseradish, as per dozen it was just a small dab.  The seafood sauce was good, and squeeze of lemon.  We ordered a ROAD combo.  Got crawfish, Shrimp and Clams.  Got the urban mix, with mild spice. I appreciate that the owner told us that even super mild spice, it will still be spicy because of the cajun spice.  The food came out pipping hot in a bag, with 2 corn, 6 sausages and 2 potatoes.  The potatoes were nice and soft, can be easily broken up using your hands.  The corn soaked up all the sauce, and it was really good.  I was worried it would be too salty, but it had the right amount of tang, spice, sweetness.  The sausage was really good, nice smokey flavour.  Now the seafood, the crawfish were good.  It was our first time having crawfish, so I don't know if they're considered fresh or not.  The heads were quite big, so kinda sucks that you only eat the small tails, but they were pretty good.  The clams were very meaty and big.  not sandy at all, and soaked up the sauce nicely.  The shrimp on the other hand were not fresh.  The meat were mushy when you tried to peel it.  I just threw some away, as I didn't want to risk any illness.  There were maybe 5-6 mushy shrimp in the batch.  Otherwise, the shrimp were very nice size.    Quite the experience, nice and quiet and not too many customers, which was nice.  Will try boiling crab or hot and juicy next time to compare the difference.

hJBie8sEwwb2aFHAUjkWdw.text: Urban Crawfish Station is located on the right of the supermarket.   Stopped by Friday around 3pm, walked in and we were the only ones there which was great. I ordered a pound of crawfish and a pound of shrimp in their urban mix with medium level spicy. The fresh crawfish was average size for $14/lb and you get about 25 shrimp for $14/lb. I didn't haven't any of the shrimp but my companion really enjoyed it. I was all about the crawfish - it was fresh and perfectly boiled.  Service was friendly and quick.   For those interested in testing out your lobster catching skills, the claw machine is straight back near the restrooms.

v5CBldweEcxNM_PEIqt3Vw.text: This has to be one of the best place to get crawfish, crab legs, mussels etc.! The employees were extremely nice and their services were unbeatable. I will be definitely coming back to this place. I highly recommend Urban Crawfish Station!

R558XidnB3FjesXsGJVKOA.text: We waited 30 minutes for a table but considering it was the shortest wait time out of all the places we went to to get a table (went to boiling crab and hot and juicy prior and all their locations were atleast 1hr to 1hr and 45 minute wait.) we decided to try this one out. Mind you this location is a lot more smaller than all the other places but it was super busy when we came in. (We came in with a group  at 7pm on a sunday night)  Food was amazing!!! And the staff was EXTREMELY nice despite how busy and hectic they were!!!  Whoever was the guy who took our order literally got every single thing on point without even writing it down he just stood there and listened and he got it all down to every detail (i was with my fam and everyone couldnt agree on what to get on one point and kept changing details on the order) but damn he got it on lock down.  Also the manager, she was extremely hospitable. And busy. She got the whole place on lock down juggling everything at the same time. Now that's how you run a business. All of the staff we encountered were extremely nice and  accommodated every request we did despite on how busy it was. Really no issue here, they definitely need to expand to a bigger space and hire more people. I will definitely come back and recommend this place

ahyGJNIK3f9jiI0ISaMroQ.text: Came here for the first time a couple of weeks ago after passing the place for months we decided to try it out.. The seafood prices was more expensive then boiling crab and hot n juicy which was a big surprise for me. But no mind that, the quality of the food was really good - their sauces is what i judged mostly because i'm a HUGE fan of all the spices and garlic of cajun/creole culture. It has some kick to it but was somewhat sweeter than other sauces i've tried. (The sauce i got was all 4 sauces mixed together called Urban Mix) it's something you have to try at least once.  I gave this place a 3/5 because of lack of customer service. When we came in a guy was being trained and there was a lady behind him correcting every little thing he said and to be honest he wasn't bad at all. He was very nice and did a good job.. I just wished it didn't happen when we were eating because it really throws off the environment and literally made it so awkward since she looked rude to him too. And also my crawfish barely had meats on them.. they were TINY tails.   This place is a good alternative to boiling crab and hot n juicy for my opinion if you don't want to wait in line and want some quick seafood or just want something a little different/diverse. Their menu selections was really good - they had large combos in the back of the menus and food ranging from gumbo, etouffee, Fried soft shell crabs, Hibachi Shrimp fried rice, to seafood spaghetti. Wow.. this was probably the most diverse menu i've seen for a seafood boil restaurant. I'll be back to try the gumbo, poboys, for sure and some other things i'm eyeing lol.   We got seated right as we came in and the interior was very adorable with crab cages decorations and a real lobster claw machine!! It was clean and spacious! The concept is the same as other places.. a huge wax paper on the table, bibs, and food in a bag. They serve all the food in a pan which is genius because it's less cleaning and more organized!  What we ordered:   -Road Combo $42: Picked Blue crab (2), Mussels, and shrimp.. came with corn, sausages, and potatoes.. pretty good  -Crawfish $12: Live crawfish with urban mix.. crawfish BARELY have any meats on them :(   -Hibachi Shrimp fried rice: Completely disgusting!! it tastes SO fishy and smelt like it too it's like a strong odor that not other shrimp fried rice should have and tastes awful   -Sweet potatoes fries: Good but not worth $5 and they don't give you a ketchup bottle like other places do..  ..Overall a pretty pleasurable experience but i'll defiantly come back for their good menu varieties!

-TZ2CrhP4pjCwxs2lsmgwA.text: Man, this place is a hidden gem! While I love it and hope it gets the business it deserves, I love that it's small and lesser known. There's hardly ever a line (maybe a 5 minute wait on the weekends) and the waitresses and waiters are always great here. Has a flavor similar to Hot n Juicy (but way better!), I wouldn't say its flavor is comparable to Boiling Crab. Market price for shrimp is around $14/lb last time I went which is the current average. They have many spice options and flavors. I always get mild garlic butter and it's soooo yummy.

OhVyooHpOnrgHPyVzSBfWg.text: THIS PLACE IS BOMB. For real I thought Hot n Juicy had the crab legs on lock -OH BUT No , this little gem is my #1 spot now. And Markeith is a sweetheart , so cool helpful and down to earth. We will be coming back !!!!!!

u_TV6WFcDMtHByTqXRoD9g.text: When we arrived... the place was a little crowded. So we were actually placed in the very back, next to the bathroom ( so nice). Next to the bathroom was a a tank, actually a claw tank with lobsters in it. That you can pay $2 a turn to catch a live lobster.... kinda creepy and sad at the same time. The waiter showed up pretty quickly to line our table with paper... just Incase we were to order crab or any shellfish that might've made a mess and out menu. It took him forever to come and take our order. After finally getting our order... it took him a while to bring back some hot sauce that I requested. My husband ordered the shrimp basket and I had the catfish basket and some fried oysters. The food was good but the service needs some help
